title: [REEF-1791] Implement Implement reef-runtime-spark
body:
*** First checkin so any constructive feedback is highly appreciated
This addressed the issue by 
  * Adding a new component called reef-runtime-spark that uses a class called SparkRunner to run a DriverLauncher reef job inside a spark flatmap function which gets created through the JavaSparkContext
  * Added a new class in the reef dataloader examples called DataLoadingREEFOnSpark which emulates the architecture of DataLoadingREEF to create the foundations for launching the spark job  
  * Made quite a few of the classes implement the Serializable interface due to Spark infrastructure requiring that any code that runs inside the spark lambda architecture (namely the flatmap function) needs Serializable classes underneath
 * Currently the code uses the LineCounter program to count the number of lines in a simple pom file across all of the spark partitions
 * No unit or integration tests included yet
  * The following are things we need to discuss related to this PR: 1) what spark versions do we support 2) it may be useful to move to Java8 sooner than latter so that we don't have to use the Java Function API that simulates lambdas in Java7 3) How do we test this at at scale and what sorts of code do we want to run in reef on spark, specifically should the next goal be to implement one or more ML algorithms or algorithms in deep learning 4) This is running currently on s single node yarn install and using the run.sh script, I think we need to come up with a more robust run architecture around this, more to come as we dig through this PR
 
JIRA:
  [REEF-1791](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1791)
 
Pull request:
  This closes #

body:

  regression tests for an application dirver.

  [REEF-1898](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1898)

Pull Request:
  Closes #1390

title: [REEF-1898] REEF Runtime Mock
body:
Currently using REEF, applications can be tested without external setup by using the local runtime. However, this method gives no visibility into Task / Evaluator failures, and successes; the local runtime mocks out components on the Container level. In order to write tests with deeper coverage, a REEF layer needs to be mocked out with hooks provided to control Task / Evaluator flow.
Activity

title: This changes the .netcore projects (*.DotNet.csproj) to target netsta…
body:
…ndard2.0 for libraries and netcoreapp2.0 for tests. The commit includes the following:

 * Moving the target frameworks into the build.DotNetLibrary.props and build.DotNetApp.props. Projects no longer define their own target frameworks and now include the appropriate .props file.
 * Adding conditional references of C# libraries to separate what is referenced for .net core builds vs .net46 or .net451.
 * Updated the code that interfaces with the Windows Azure Storage library since the non-async calls are note available for .netcore. To keep the code consistent for .netcore and .net, the new code calls the appropriate async version of the API and blocks until the call is complete. This also updates the tests to do the same thing.
 * Additional changes to the xunit.DotNet.props to get tests working on all platforms.

With these changes, we can now build the existing DotNet projects on linux platforms.

JIRA: [REEF-1885](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1885)

Pull request:
        This closes #

title: [Do not merge] Request for Comments: Example of Peer-to-Peer communication between tasks
body:
This branch contains an example of Peer-to-Peer communication between tasks, and contains a stand-alone communicator module that could be of use in other REEF projects where task-task communication is necessary.
 - Is this example worthwhile to add to REEF?
 - Is the Communicator module worth adding as a feature to REEF?

title: [REEF-1876] Support enums in named parameters in Tang.
body:
Summary of changes:
   * Add support for simple Java enums in named parameters in Tang. Invoke a static method `.valueOf(String)` of the corresponding enum to instantiate an object, if necessary.
   * Add unit tests to check the new functionality for explicit and default enum parameters.

**NOTE:** This is a Java part of the implementation. We also need to implement it in C# (issue [REEF-1877](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1877))

  * Expose to REEF users hard Evaluator preemption on YARN.

  For test, you have to enable preemption and configure 2 queues in YARN,
  queue A with 80% and queue B with 20% of total resources.
  Use following command for test.
  runyarntests.sh org.apache.reef.tests.yarnpreemption.YarnPreemptionTest

title: [REEF-1584] Fix CoreCLR Issues in Org.Apache.REEF.IO
body:
#This addressed the issue by
  * Targeting .NET Core 2.0 Framework
  * Rewriting the `DirectoryInfo.Create(DirectorySecurity)` and `CreateSubdirectory(DirectorySecurity)` methods to use the `SetAccessControl` APIs that are supported in .NET Core 2.0
    * See the Extension Methods section of the [.NET Standard 2.0 documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.io.directoryinfo?view=netstandard-2.0) for details on the supported APIs. (Note that these extensions are all .NET Core 2.0, not .NET Standard.)

title: [REEF-1842]  Making IMRU task and input data association deterministic
body:
* Use partitionDescriptor id as part of the context id so that context id is associated with a fixed partitionDescriptor. Please notice that the partition descriptor id always follows the pattern like RandomInputPartition-x and is unique
* Make contexts stored in a sorted collection to ensure tasks with associated context/partitionDescriptor are always add to group in the same sequence.

title: [REEF-1827] new Uri(path) in REEF.NET IO Returns Lowercase String
body:
This corresponds to [REEF-1827](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1827). In the Org.Apache.REEF.IO.FileSystem.IFileSystem, we have many methods that are based on C#'s Uri. For example:
```
void CopyToLocal(Uri remoteFileUri, string localName);
void CreateDirectory(Uri directoryUri);
```
From the logging and my experiments, this converts path to lowercase characters. For example:
```
new Uri("hdfs://XYZ123/mypath/data.txt") // Returns "hdfs://xyz123/mypath/data.txt"
```
If we are interacting with hdfs, in the subsequent dfs command in Org.Apache.REEF.IO.FileSystem.Hadoop:
```
public void CopyToLocal(Uri remoteFileUri, string localName)
{
    _commandRunner.Run("dfs -get " + remoteFileUri + " " + localName);
}
```
this will fail, since hdfs is case-sensitive.

JIRA:
[REEF-1827](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1827)

Pull request:
#1329

body:
This corresponds to [REEF-1827](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1827). In the Org.Apache.REEF.IO.FileSystem.IFileSystem, we have many methods that are based on C#'s Uri. For example:
```
void CopyToLocal(Uri remoteFileUri, string localName);
void CreateDirectory(Uri directoryUri);
```
From the logging and my experiments, this converts path to lowercase characters. For example:
```
new Uri("hdfs://XYZ123/mypath/data.txt") // Returns "hdfs://xyz123/mypath/data.txt"
```
If we are interacting with hdfs, in the subsequent dfs command in Org.Apache.REEF.IO.FileSystem.Hadoop:
```
public void CopyToLocal(Uri remoteFileUri, string localName)
{
    _commandRunner.Run("dfs -get " + remoteFileUri + " " + localName);
}
```
this will fail, since hdfs is case-sensitive.

title: [REEF-1820] Allow to specify node names and relaxLocality flag settin…
body:
…g when requesting evaluators.

      - Add two new member variables to lang/cs/Org.Apache.REEF.Driver.Evaluator/EvaluatorRequestBuilder.cs
      to allow caller to specify the node names and relaxLocality setting while building EvaluatorRequest.
      If caller doesn't want to specify nodeNames then an empty list is propagated to Java layer. Default
      value of relaxLocality is TRUE. YARN RM will try to schedule TASK on the nodes specified in nodeNames.
      relaxLocality for a request at a network hierarchy level, set whether locality can be relaxed
      to that level and beyond.If the flag is off on a rack-level ResourceRequest, containers at
      that request's priority will not be assigned to nodes on that request's rack unless requests
      specifically for those nodes have also been submitted.
						If the relaxLocality flag is off on an ANY-level ResourceRequest, containers
						at that request's priority will only be assigned on racks for which specific
						requests have also been submitted.

    JIRA:
      [REEF-1820](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1820)

    Pull Request:
      This closes #

title: [REEF-1791] Implement reef-runtime-spark
body:
This is an initial design in place for reef-runtime-spark, details are shown below:
* Design consists of two parts, a spark-launcher process that launches the reef process in an already existing spark architecture and a set of tests represented by [~motus] implementation of the reef on spark example
* A pom file that builds the test jar and the spark launcher code
* Successful passes through checkstyle hurdles
* Added reef-runtime-spark to outer level pom file
* The design is meant to be generic so that any resource manager can be used, although for now its more targeted towards yarn

****NOTE this code is not tested or complete by any means, I wanted to send out the initial design as a pull request to get that agreed upon by the community before proceeding further, once the design is solidified I will send another pull request which will be ready for merge

title: [REEF-1763] Replace bridge interop calls with Avro messages
body:
This change represents the first step in converting the bridge Java/C#
  interop to Avro messages.
  - Used the Wake RemoteManager class in both Java and C# to build a
    network avro messaging system between the Java and C# sides of the bridge.
  - Implemented generation of common messages in the
    org.apache.reef.bridge.message namespace. The Java side uses the maven
    avro plugin to perform avro to java code generation from the avsc files.
    The C# side uses a powershell script to call the Microsoft Avro avsc
    to C# code. There is NO editing of the generated avro files. The C#
    code generation will be added to the build in a future checkin
    (REEF-1805)
  - During bridge network initialization, both sides use reflection to
    discover all messages and auto generate serializers and deserializers
    for each message.
  - When the Java side initializes it writes it address and port to a file
    so it can be discovered by the C# side.
  - All content messages are preceeded by a well know header messeage that
    tells the deserializer which message specific deserialier to invoke to
    deserialize the following message.
  - Message send calls block until and acknowledgement is received or a
    timeout occurs.
  - Currently messages are indentified by strings in the header message.
    This will be converted integers when protocol negotiation is added in
    (REEF-1807).
  - Added a new Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.CLR project that will become the C#
    executable side of the bridge when the current Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge C++
    project is fully removed (REEF-1806).
  - Replaced the callClrSystemOnStartHandler with an Avro message.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1763] (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1763)

Pull Request:
  Closes:

title: [REEF-1763] Replace bridge interop calls with Avro messages
body:
This change represents the first step in converting the bridge Java/C#
  interop to Avro messages.
  - Used the Wake RemoteManager class in both Java and C# to build a
    network avro messaging system between the Java and C# sides of the bridge.
  - Implemented generation of common messages in the
    org.apache.reef.bridge.message namespace. The Java side uses the maven
    avro plugin to perform avro to java code generation from the avsc files.
    The C# side uses a powershell script to call the Microsoft Avro avsc
    to C# code. There is NO editing of the generated avro files. The C#
    code generation will be added to the build in a future checkin
    (REEF-1805)
  - During bridge network initialization, both sides use reflection to
    discover all messages and auto generate serializers and deserializers
    for each message.
  - When the Java side initializes it writes it address and port to a file
    so it can be discovered by the C# side.
  - All content messages are preceeded by a well know header messeage that
    tells the deserializer which message specific deserialier to invoke to
    deserialize the following message.
  - Message send calls block until and acknowledgement is received or a
    timeout occurs.
  - Currently messages are indentified by strings in the header message.
    This will be converted integers when protocol negotiation is added in
    (REEF-1807).
  - Added a new Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.CLR project that will become the C#
    executable side of the bridge when the current Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge C++
    project is fully removed (REEF-1806).
  - Replaced the Call_ClrSystem_SetupBridgeHandlerManager call with an
    Avro message.

JIRA:
  [REEF-1763] (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1763)

Pull Request:
  Closes:
